head.title: How Just Is Justice in the Lone Star State?

hedline.hl1: How Just Is Justice in the Lone Star State?

block.p: Texas Defender Service, a nonprofit group of defense lawyers, released a broad and scathing assessment of Texas's administration of the death penalty. The group found that the system was corroded with prosecutorial misconduct, racial bias and a failure to provide adequate counsel to indigent capital defendants. The report also said too many defendants are convicted based on unreliable testimony from jailhouse informants or from dubious experts. State officials and prosecutors rejected the claims.
